Word.word: The word in the dictionary (any word that would be defined).
Word.aspirate: Whether or not the word starts with an aspirate h. Some adjectives that come before words that start with a non-aspirate h have an extra form (AdjectiveForms -> na [non-aspirate]).

GrammaticalForm.form: The grammatical form of the word is the grammatical context in which it is used. Forms may consist of a word in noun, adjective, adverb, exclamatory or other form. Each form (generally) has its own definition, as the meaning of the word changes in the way it is used.
GrammaticalForm.definition: The definition of the word in context of the grammatical form.

NounForms.ms: The masculin singular form of the noun.
NounForms.fs: The feminin singular form of the noun.
NounForms.mpl: The masculin plural form of the noun.
NounForms.fpl: The feminin plural form of the noun.
NounForms.gender: The gender of the noun. Determines what form the adjective that describes it needs to have.

AdjectiveForms.ms: The masculin singular form of the adjective.
AdjectiveForms.fs: The feminin singular form of the adjective.
AdjectiveForms.mpl: The masculin plural form of the adjective.
AdjectiveForms.fpl: The feminin plural form of the adjective.
AdjectiveForms.na: The non-aspirate form of the adjective, in the case where the adjective is followed by a non-aspirate word.
AdjectiveForms.location: Where the adjective is placed around the noun (before, after, or both).

VerbForms.group: What group the verb belongs to; f (first), s (second), t (third) or e (exception).
VerbForms.auxillary: The auxillary verb taken by the verb; e (être) or a (avoir)
VerbForms.prepositions: A CSV list of valid prepositions this verb uses; for grammatical analysis.
VerbForms.transitive: Whether or not the verb is transitive.
VerbForms.pronominal: Whether or not the verb allows pronominal construction.

Infinitive.present: The present infinitive form of the verb.
Infinitive.past: The past infinitive form of the verb.

Participle.present: The present participle of the verb.
Participle.past: The past partciple of the verb.
